API Documentation¶

For normal use, all you will have to do to get started is:

from wpCalc import L1WaterProductivity

This will import the following:

  • The class :L1WaterProductivity:`L1WaterProductivity` and its subclasses
  • Several constants representing the datasets available in Google Earth Engine and the visualization parameters.

The Water Productivity class¶

class wapor_algorithms.L1WaterProductivity¶

Create Water Productivity raster file for annual and dekadal timeframes for Level 1 (Countries and Basins

generate_areal_stats(paese, wbpm_calc)¶

INCOMPLETE Calculates several statistics for the Water Productivity calculated raster for a chosen country

generate_tiles()¶

INCOMPLETE Split the calculated WPbm in72 tiles facilitating the export

generate_ts(paese, data_start, data_end, dataset)¶

Generate a chart with the mean values calculated for a chosen country

image_export(exp_type, WPbm)¶

INCOMPLETE Export the 72 of the calculated WPbm to Google Drive, GEE Asset or generating a ulr for each tile

water_productivity_gross_biomass(L1_AGBP_calc, L1_AET_calc)¶

WPbm calculation returns all intermediate results besides the final WPbm

aet_aggregated¶

Returns both datasets to be used for WPbm

image_visualization(viz_type, L1_AGBP, ETaColl3, WPbm)¶

Output the calculated WPbm using a map vizualizer or a chart (in this case every componenet of the caluclation is plotted

map_id_getter(wpbm_calc)¶

Generate a map id and a token for the calcualted WPbm raster file

multiply_npp¶

Returns the dataset to be used in conjunction with Actual Evapotranspiration for WPbm

Constants¶

  • _L1_AGBP_SEASONAL is projects/fao-wapor/L1_AGBP
  • _L1_AGBP_DEKADAL is projects/fao-wapor/L1_AGBP250
  • _L1_ETa_DEKADAL is projects/fao-wapor/L1_AET
  • _L1_AET250 is users/lpeiserfao/AET250
  • _L1_NPP_DEKADAL is projects/fao-wapor/L1_NPP250
  • VisPar_AGBPy
  • VisPar_ETay
  • VisPar_WPbm
